article: monarch butterflies making their annual migration from the eastern united states to winter residences in mexico 's sierra madre mountain range find their way by following a three-dimensional map made of rays of polarized ultraviolet light , according to a new study .
abstract: ultraviolet light is key to butterfly navigation
